intro: Jonthlaspi lappaceum, commonly known as the alpine cabbageweed, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and features basal rosettes of pale green, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found on rocky slopes and gravelly soils. Jonthlaspi lappaceum is adapted to harsh climates and is typically found in mountainous regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
